715: Position Summary Tyto Athene has an opening for a Senior Specialist Intelligence Analyst position located at CS-JB Anacostia, Washington DC supporting the National Aviation Intelligence Integration Office (NAI2O) and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, National Intelligence Manager for Aviation (ODNI/NIM Aviation). Responsibilities: Provide proper oversight and management of on-sight contractor activities in accordance with A2 and ODNI policies. Prepare Monthly Status Reports (MSR), which describe the status/progress of the tasks identified in the PWS. The MSRs shall summarize activities completed during the previous month. The Government may require additional information on an as needed basis. General Senior Staff officer duties Write well, anticipate customer needs, and distill complex ideas into key points Strategy Development Contribute to the development of the Unifying Intelligence Strategy for Aviation and associated Key Intelligence Questions or other strategies as needed. Translate strategic plans into goals and objective and how to achieve them Support to National Policy (NSC staff functions) on aviation issues Could be called upon for any aviation related topic but my focus has been aviation cyber issues, threats to aviation in conflict zones, and topics related to hypersonic systems Daily planning, production, and dissemination of communications, to include oral, written and graphical. On a range of issuesâ€¦lots of writing, particularly at the executive level. Review external strategies, proposed policies or regulations, analytical products, concepts of operations, technical papers etc., for aviation intelligence equities. Address intelligence production, dissemination, collection, knowledge management Knowledge of the intelligence community collection, reporting and analytic capabilities, responsibilities, and activities Evaluate ability of IC to meet aviation related collection and analytic requirements. Lead project to determine ability to collect and analyze. Current major effort concerns adversary hypersonic systems. Knowledge of data analytics would be very useful. Establish Collection and Analytic Priorities Review collection requirements Contribute to the development and promulgation of guidance for analytic production to the intelligence community on aviation intelligence issues Interagency engagement Engage daily with any number of organizations across the DoD, IC or interagency. Key organizations: DIA, NSA, ODNI office, DoD Staff, Service Production Centers, COCOM J2 staffs, FAA, TSA, DHS Topical issues (current focus) Attend meetings, telecons and other events related to these topics-what are the issues for the IC? What are IC capabilities to collect and analyze Numerous components across the 6As Across all categories Aviation Cyber Unmanned Aircraft Systems PNT issues, space-based systems as they pertain to navigation of aircraft Hypersonic Systems (adversary system development, associated missile defense) Emerging Tech Civil/Military aviation integration Skilled at putting together and running large events such as conferences, TTXs, etc. Ability to travel Qualifications: An ideal candidate would have the required years of experience, particularly in the Defense Intelligence Enterprise. Experience on a COCOM, Service, or IC org staff; experience in either intelligence collections or analysis. While operational civil and military experience is helpful, IC experience would be more valuable. Need to be able to write and speak well and anticipate/act on customer needs. Someone with background in UAS, cyber or hypersonic would be a key candidate. Minimum Education and Experience: A master's degree in a field related to intelligence or aviation with at least 10 years of combined experience. A master's degree may be replaced with a bachelor's degree and at least 15 years of combined experience in intelligence and aviation. A comprehensive understanding of the Intelligence Community (IC) and the Global Aviation Domain. Significant experience performing program management within the IC, DoD or Federal Interagency. Experience in Strategic Communications. Experience with Collections Management. Experience in translating strategic plans and other guidance into business processes, policies, standards, and procedures. Active TS/SCI clearance Equal Opportunity Employer: Disability/Veteran About Tyto Athene Tyto is an IT services and solutions company that provides mission-focused digital transformation to enhance the client experience and enable them to achieve desired outcomes. Tyto's services and solutions embody its domain expertise in four major Technology domains: Network Modernization, Hybrid Cloud, Cyber Security, and Enterprise IT. Tyto offers a broad range of service delivery models including design/install projects, Managed Services, and 'As-a-Service'. With over fifty years of experience, Tyto supports Defense, Intelligence, Space, National Security, Civilian, Health and Public Safety clients across the United States and around the globe. Requirements: After several strategic acquisitions in 2021, Tyto Athene has experienced enormous opportunity and growth. Aside from being the leading provider of mission-focused IT and Cyber services and solutions to critical U.S. government agencies, Tyto is well-positioned to meet the growing demand for network modernization requirements across the federal enterprise. Our employees are the key to the innovation that has made Tyto a success. We provide an environment that is geared to reward potential, innovation, and teamwork. If you would like to unleash your creativity and your career - it's time to join Team Tyto!
